DataElement.preferredName: Urinary System American Urological Association Symptom Assessment Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the compiled score of self-reported urinary system performance, function, quality, or ability as measured by the American Urological Association (AUA).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The organs of the body that produce and discharge urine. These include the kidneys, ureters, bladder, and urethra._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The organs of the body that produce and discharge urine. These include the kidneys, ureters, bladder, and urethra.

Concepts.definition: The organs involved in the creation and excretion of urine.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: American Urological Association Symptom Assessment Total Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability for the American Urological Association Symptom Score._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease. DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR trial. The AUA Symptom Score is a measure of the American Urological Association.
